New Records: Ben Stokes scored 108, his first century in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup, with six fours and six sixes.
Dawid Malan contributed 87 runs with 10 fours and two sixes.
Netherlands were bowled out for 179, with Teja Nidamanuru scoring 41.
England's total of 339 was their highest score in the tournament.
Key Match Events: Netherlands lost their last five wickets for 16 runs.
Ben Stokes and Chris Woakes formed a 129-run stand.
Logan van Beek took two key breakthroughs, dismissing Joe Root and Dawid Malan.
Pre-Game Insights: England batted first after Jos Buttler won the toss.
Netherlands elected to field, with Scott Edwards as captain.
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes was praised for his century and performance.
The win boosted England's morale ahead of the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's batting depth and spinners' contributions were highlighted.
The match was part of the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup.
Others: The match was played in Pune, with Harry Brook and Gus Atkinson returning to the England squad.
Netherlands all-rounder Roelof van der Merwe made an impact with bat and ball.
